sentences: Sir Robert Bryson Hall II (born January 22, 1990), known professionally as Logic, is an American rapper and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: He has released six studio albums and received two Grammy Award nominations.
section: N/A

sentences: Logic began his music career in 2010, releasing the mixtape Young, Broke & Infamous; he gained popularity with his Young Sinatra mixtape series, with the response to its third iteration, Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever (2013), helping Logic secure a recording contract with Def Jam Recordings.
section: N/A

sentences: Logic's first two studio albums — Under Pressure (2014) and The Incredible True Story (2015) — both peaked within the top five on the U.S. Billboard 200, while the former was ultimately certified platinum.
section: N/A

sentences: Logic achieved mainstream popularity in 2017 with Everybody; the album charted at number one in the United States and was certified platinum, while its lead single, "1-800-273-8255", reached number three on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100, and was a top-ten hit internationally.
section: N/A

sentences: He also released the commercial mixtape series Bobby Tarantino.
section: N/A

sentences: His fourth and fifth albums, YSIV (2018) and Confessions of a Dangerous Mind (2019), achieved similar commercial success, with the latter containing the single "Homicide", which peaked at number 5 on the Hot 100.
section: N/A

sentences: After his sixth album No Pressure (2020), Logic retired from music; he returned to music in 2021.
section: N/A

sentences: As an author, Logic released the novel Supermarket (2019), which was accompanied by a soundtrack of the same name.
section: N/A

sentences: The book became a New York Times Best Seller, but both works received generally mixed to negative critical reception.
section: N/A

sentences: He published his memoir, This Bright Future, in 2021.
section: N/A

== Early life and education ==

sentences: Early life and education
section: == Early life and education ==
== Early life and education ==

sentences: Sir Robert Bryson Hall II was born on January 22, 1990, at Shady Grove Hospital in Rockville, Maryland.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: He was born to Robert Bryson Hall, a black Maryland native, and a white mother.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Between his father and mother, he has seven half-siblings.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Logic spent much of his youth in the West Deer Park neighborhood in Gaithersburg, Maryland.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: His father suffered from a cocaine addiction and his mother suffered from alcoholism.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Despite his father initially being absent in his childhood, Logic was able to reconnect with Hall due to his burgeoning rap career.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: During his early adolescent years, Logic witnessed his brothers produce and distribute crack cocaine to "addicts all over the block", including to his father.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Logic maintains that he accurately knows how to manufacture and produce crack cocaine following these experiences.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: He attended neighboring Gaithersburg High School.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: However, he did not graduate and was soon expelled after he began skipping classes in the tenth grade.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Logic would comment on the expulsion, stating "I started doing badly and failed every class but English, so they kicked me out of school, they gave up on me."
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: In early 2013, Logic was featured in an edition of XXL, being included as a part of the publication's annual "Top 10 Freshmen List", alongside artists Travis Scott, Trinidad James, Dizzy Wright, Action Bronson, Joey Badass, Angel Haze, Ab-Soul, Chief Keef, Kirko Bangz and Schoolboy Q. Logic completed his first European tour in March 2013, and confirmed his fourth mixtape, Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever, would be released on May 7.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2013: Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever and recording contract ===

sentences: He announced his second headlining national tour, the two-month-long Welcome to Forever Tour, to promote the project.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2013: Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever and recording contract ===

sentences: The mixtape was a critical success, with critics praising the project, calling it a "free album", as well as noting the rapper's rapid growth and adaptability.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2013: Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever and recording contract ===

sentences: The mixtape has received over 900,000 downloads on DatPiff since its release.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2013: Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever and recording contract ===

sentences: On April 15, it was announced that Logic had signed with Def Jam Recordings, with Def Jam producer No I.D. serving as the executive producer of his debut album.

sentences: Logic released a public statement about the signing, stating, "I'm excited to take this next step in my career.

sentences: It's incredible for Def Jam [Records] and Visionary Music Group to work together, and the opportunity to collaborate [with No I.D.] is priceless.
section: == Career == | === 2012–2013: Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever and recording contract ===

sentences: I'm very humbled to be a part of the most iconic hip hop label of all time."
section: == Career == | === 2012–2013: Young Sinatra: Welcome to Forever and recording contract ===

sentences: Logic toured with Kid Cudi, fellow Def Jam signee Big Sean, and Tyler, the Creator on "The Cud Life Tour 2013", throughout the fall of the year.

sentences: On April 23, Logic's YouTube channel BobbysWorld uploaded a song entitled "Mars Only Pt. 3", a collaboration between him and producer Madlib.
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===

sentences: Together, the duo is called Madgic, a portmanteau of their names.
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===

sentences: The duo has released two more songs, "Raddest Dad" and "Mafia Music" in the same way.
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===

sentences: On June 16, Logic announced a return to music, mimicking the statement issued by Michael Jordan upon his return to basketball.
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===

sentences: On June 18, he released the song "Intro", his first since returning to music, and over the following month he would release a series of singles presumed to be a part of an upcoming project.
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===

sentences: He released his seventh mixtape, Bobby Tarantino III, on July 30, 2021, which included 4 out of 5 of the singles released during the previous month ("Intro" was not included in the mixtape).
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===

sentences: In 2022, Logic will be a guest star in the upcoming animated series The Legend of Vox Machina.
section: == Career == | === 2021–present: Return to music, Memoir, and Bobby Tarantino III ===
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2013, Logic stated that while growing up, he smoked marijuana.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Logic was addicted to cigarettes, dedicating the song "Nikki" from Under Pressure to the subject.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He speaks about smoking since he was 13 and that, when giving up marijuana and alcohol, he could not overcome the addiction until 2014.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He pledged not to smoke another cigarette after the release of Under Pressure.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On October 22, 2015, Logic married Jessica Andrea, a singer and his then-girlfriend of two years.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In March 2018, he announced their separation, and filed for divorce the following month.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Nevertheless, they remain friends and did not cite anger as the reason for their split.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Logic married Brittney Noell in September 2019.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They have one son.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Logic also has a YouTube channel where he posts videos about his favorite video games.
section: == Personal life ==
== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Logic cites Frank Sinatra as his main inspiration.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Sinatra's influence can be seen in several aspects of Logic's persona, with Logic having the "RattPack" (a play on Sinatra's "Rat Pack" and an acronym for "Real All the Time").
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: The group initially consisted of Logic's manager Christian Zarou, executive producer 6ix, and rappers C Dot Castro and Big Lenbo.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He also describes his female fans as "BobbySoxers", as well as referring to himself as "Young Sinatra".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: As a child, his mother made him watch old black and white movies, which formed his love for the singer.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Logic cites Sinatra as instrumental to him being able to carry and articulate himself the way he does, with Logic describing him as an individual who "showcased peace, love, grace, positivity, honor, and valor".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Logic has said that various forms of entertainment across many platforms have influenced him, including A Tribe Called Quest, Mos Def, Outkast, Red Hot Chili Peppers, J. Cole, Drake, Eminem, the Wu-Tang Clan, and films by Quentin Tarantino.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In an interview with XXL, Logic stated, "I love all subgenres within hip-hop and all genres of music, and I think that's what allows me to make the music that I do, because of my appreciation for the music."
section: == Artistry ==
